Dialogue.Page: TRAPPIST-1b is the closest planet to the star TRAPPIST-1.
TRAPPIST-1b is a terrestrial planet orbiting extremely close to TRAPPIST-1, about 1% of earths orbital distance.
It receives 4 times the amount of light as Earth, putting it well outside the habitable zone.
Due to it's low density, it's likely covered by an enormous amount of water, mostly likely as vapor.
It probably has a massive incredibly thick greenhouse atmosphere, much larger and hotter than that of venus.
TRAPPIST-1b is likely to have a thick greenhouse atmosphere, possibly even thicker than Venus's, heating the surface to well over 1500K.
Due to the planet's low density, a mostly water vapor atmosphere is likely, although a carbon dioxide or pure oxygen atmosphere has not been ruled out.
A Venus-like CO2 atmosphere could be over 30 km tall, in comparison to Venus's 16 km.
A water vapor atmosphere would have to be even larger, over 100 km tall.
The green and red colors it's depicted as are purely speculative.
All terrestrial planets start there lives completely covered in global magma ocean, and TRAPPIST-1b is no exception.
They usually cool off and solidify after some time, but due to its extreme surface temperature, b may have retained its magma ocean into the modern day.
